page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The names of the three villages in our area are Hopton Doddington and Cleeton, all show that they were Anglo-Saxon settlements. Hopton means a village in a valley. Cleeton means a village on Clee Hill . The old village near cleeton gate was deserted and a new one was built by George Pardoe,further up the hill in 1870. One of the landmarks in our area is the Three Forked Pole which points to three different parishs Hopton, Bitterly, and Coreley.It has stood there for hundreds of years and has recently been renewed.There was a thirving paper-making industry in Hopton.Rags were brought from Bewdley and made into paper in mills situated on Hopton Brook behind the Manor House.
